RACE.RACE_TEXT: CTM Distance S. CENTURY MILE RACE 1 870 Y Dirt CR: 70. Stakes Purse 21000. A STAKE FOR THREE-YEAR-OLDS AND UPWARD QUARTER HORSES. A payment of $200.00 is required at time of entry. Preference guides can be found in the AQHRA Stakes Book. Weight: Three-Year-Olds 124 lbs. Older: 126 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SS PINEAPPLE vied for the early lead, gained the advantage, and edged clear in the final stages. BIG BOSS dueled for the early lead, and weakened late. TIMBERS EXPRESS away last, and lodged a late mild bid. TIMBERS MOON chased wide and tired.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 10000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE IN 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (Lesser Claiming Races Not Considered In Eligibility). Alberta Bred Claiming Price $5,000 .
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HARD TO COME HOME tracked inside, angled sharply to the rail when a seam freed up in the final sixteenth, and was up in time to score the win. REDNECK REMARK vied hard inside, took over into the stretch but was caught late. CARSON'S LEGACY chased three wide leaving the backstretch, rallied four wide midstretch, and missed after a solid effort. YORKTOWN was quickest to the turn, was overtaken after the quarter pole, kept on evenly through the stretch, and yielded in the final yards. SILVER SPUN unhurried early, fanned four wide into the opening turn, and tired. VISION QUEST offered little.

ENTRY.NAME: Hard to Come Home
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, angled inside, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Vision Quest
ENTRY.OWNER: Kleparchuk Victor Kleparchuk Mike and Viking Stables

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Princess Margaret S. CENTURY MILE RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 63. Stakes Purse 50000. A STAKE FOR TWO-YEAR-OLD FILLIES. A fee of $100.00 required to nominate. A payment of $500.00 is required to pass the entry box and an additional $400.00 is required to start. The purse will be divided $30,000 to the owner of the winner, $10,000 to the se cond place finisher, $5,000 to the third place finisher, $2,500 to the fourth place finisher and $1,000 to the fifth place finisher. A payment of $500.00 will be paid to all horses who start and finish sixth or worse. Starters to be named through the entr y box by the closing time of entries. The field will be limited to 12 starters. Preference will be given to those horses with the highest earnings. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. Weight: 123 lbs. Maidens allowed 3 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISS MIEZIE sped to the front, opened up when given her cue, and coasted in nearing the wire. SILKSTONE trailed early, angled outside to the three path, and finished up clearly second-best. BIRDY'S ON FIRE sat just off the pacesetter from the three path, chased through the stretch, and faded. JODEYS LIL PAIN saved ground and lacked a closing response. *SILKSTONE was reported by the Official Veterinarian as having bled.

ENTRY.NAME: Silkstone
ENTRY.OWNER: Everblack Cattle Co Ltd Stetson Enterprises Ltd and Stetson Ryan

ENTRY.NAME: Jodeys Lil Pain
ENTRY.OWNER: C and H Duggan Farms Ltd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 90. Allowance Purse 23000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RACE HOME raced in close quarters in the first turn while under a snug hold, seized the moment positioning himself within a tight opening as they entered the backstretch, moved up alongside THESHACK to dispute the front, embraced the challenge from DECOY in the stretch, ultimately crossing the finish line in record-setting time. DECOY unhurried early, shadowed the pacesetters, drove four wide off the final turn then advanced assertively, yet despite the formidable effort, couldn't manage to overtake RACE HOME. I'M DASHING chased inside early, rallied then weakened in the later stages. SLAATS sat just off the pace while three to four wide, was roused at the quarter pole and flattened out. THESHACK set a pressured pace between rivals, was overtaken, and gave way. VIATURE trailed throughout.

ENTRY.NAME: Race Home
ENTRY.COMMENT: closed quarters, contested, new track record

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Canadian Juvenile S. CENTURY MILE RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 70. Stakes Purse 50000. A BLACK TYPE STAKE FOR TWO-YEAR-OLDS. A fee of $100.00 required to nominate. A payment of $500.00 is required to pass the entry box and an additional $400.00 is required to start. The purse will be divided $30,000 to the owner of the winner, $10,000 to th e second place finisher, $5,000 to the third place finisher, $2,500 to the fourth place finisher and $1,000 to the fifth place finisher. A payment of $500 will be paid to all horses who start and finish 6th or worse. Starters to be named through the entr y box by the closing time of entries. The field will be limited to 12 starters. Preference will be given to those horses with the highest earnings at time of entry. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. Colts and Geldings : 124 lbs. Fillies : 121 lbs. Maidens allowed 3 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TIPSY TALES challenged the early pace while positioned inside of ITSALLGOODMAN, dueled throughout the far turn, continued to battle inside, and inched clear refusing to relinquish the lead. ITSALLGOODMAN quickly went to the front then contended the pace outside, matched strides with TIPSY TALES into the stretch, and gave way grudgingly after a long hard drive. THUNDER ROARS bumped away from the gate, chased five wide into the lane, and closed well to secure show. GRATED COCONUT rated well off the pacesetters, rallied inside under urging and tapered off late. PATRIOTIC FREEDOM failed to threaten. DOUG'S HERO bumped leaving, was gapped then was eased to the finish line and walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Thunder Roars
ENTRY.OWNER: C and H Duggan Farms Ltd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 12500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE IN 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250 (Lesser Claiming Races Fo r $6,000 (AB $8,000) Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility). Alberta Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THRILL OF THE NITE pressed the early pace, dueled determinedly inside through the far turn, gained a short advantage over SMILIN EVIE and just held after a long hard drive. SMILIN EVIE vied for the early lead, responded gamely to a challenge from THRILL OF THE NITE, was overtaken into the stretch, dug in in the late stages gaining inches back on the aforementioned, and just missed. CHATTY GAL reserved off the dueling pacesetters, took closer order under encouragement then angled out to the four path, and finished evenly. TALA saved ground inside, was hustled outside off the final turn, and closed well under mild handling. STOLEN JEWEL unhurried early, and lacked a closing response. FLORIST settled outside and lacked a bid.

ENTRY.NAME: Tala
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, hustled outside, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Smilin Evie
ENTRY.OWNER: Clark Ann and Clary Robert A

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 19500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING $17,500. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $17,500. Alberta Bred Claiming Price $22,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CREDIBILITY sat just off the pace, dueled outside of BACKSTREET BOBBY, battled determinedly between rivals into the stretch, was under pressure and held late. KYSTONE stalked inside, angled out to the four path then moved up menacingly alongside CREDIBILITY, but was unable to get by. NORTHERN JEWEL saved ground inside, rallied three wide into the stretch and was along in time for show. BACKSTREET BOBBY contended the early pace, was overtaken approaching the stretch and gave way. PARKING PERMIT raced four wide into the opening turn, and lacked a kick needed. SILVERFOOT sat midpack early, and lodged a mild bid. FLASHFORDANI rated off the pace, and was unable to improve position late.

ENTRY.NAME: Kystone
ENTRY.OWNER: Empire Equestrian Kerredge Farm Stock Curtis McPherson Cam and Lenheiser Ray

ENTRY.NAME: Credibility
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled outside, battled determinedly, held late

ENTRY.NAME: Parking Permit
ENTRY.OWNER: Hurley Racing Stable and Walper, Deanna

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 95. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 20000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING $25,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000. Alberta Bred Claiming Price $31,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IMPACTO vied for the early lead, showed the way through the backstretch, and was wrapped up late. COUNTRIFIED trailed the field, circled into the lane, closed steadily outside and got up for second. DRINKING AGAIN chased inside, rallied into the stretch then flattened out settling for show. ROCKTILLYOUDROP settled five to six wide through the backstretch, launched an all-out bid into the stretch, and yielded late. SLEW'S BAK chased the pacesetters from the three path, rallied between foes at the head of the stretch and gave way. STONE CARVER vied four-wide leaving the chute, chased IMPACTO into the final turn, and came up empty in the drive. WALKTHELINE showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Impacto
ENTRY.OWNER: Dialed In Racing Stable and Smokin Guns Stable

ENTRY.NAME: Countrified
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, circled, closed steadily, got up 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 9 7F Dirt CR: 86. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 19000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING $12,000 WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR ALBERTA BREDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,000. Alberta Bred Claiming Price $15,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: READYTOTAPNSING stalked inside, waited for running room in the turn, slipped through along the rail when seam opened up at the head of the lane, kicked clear, and was kept under a strong hand ride to the wire. FOUR O SIX CREED was brushed entering the backstretch in traffic, sat in range from the five path, drove five wide off the final turn, closed gradually and got by just in time to score place. MACHINE sat in range, rallied inside through the stretch, and was nipped before the wire. BRODY'S PAL stalked three wide, lost position in the final turn, and bid belatedly. RUNNINFORCOVER trailed the field, lodged a bid along the rail, and weakened. NICE GUY EDDIE bumped entering the backstretch, raced five wide into the far turn, and faded. MIDNITE CHILL contended the early pace, and faltered in the stretch. SANSOME raced wide entering the backstretch, moved up to contest the pace, dueled through the far turn outside of MIDNITE CHILL and wilted.

ENTRY.NAME: Four O Six Creed
ENTRY.OWNER: Bakke Wayne Lindell Jill J and Hoines Nathan
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed, in range 5w, drove 5w, closed gradually, up 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 10 6F Dirt CR: 84. Claiming Purse 10500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR ALBERTA BREDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,000 (Lesser Claiming Races For $3, 500 (AB $4,500) At Century Mile Not Considered In Eligibility). Alberta Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PUMP THE BRAKES attended the pace from the three path, overtook the lead approaching the quarter pole, and kicked clear under light handling. PULL THE PIN unhurried early, swung wide at the head of the lane, closed steadily under light encouragement, and was along in time for place. BOSS MAN CAN vied inside from the three path, was overtaken near the quarter pole, lost path at the head of the stretch, angled out and was caught late. SNAP COUNT saved ground from the rail, chased into the stretch and gave way in the final sixteenth. TRICKY SPEEDSTER gave chased from the four path, and improved position late. INDEPENDENCE NEIGH chased the early pacesetters, and faded. HIGH FLYIN TIGER lagged early and passed a tiring rival. STORMY SUMMIT showed initial speed between foes, and was done early.

ENTRY.NAME: Boss Man Can
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied inside, lost path, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Snap Count
ENTRY.OWNER: Salt River Holdings Inc and Viking Stables

ENTRY.NAME: Pull the Pin
ENTRY.OWNER: Elliott, Madeleine, Langlois, Antoine, Oxley, Sandy and Walper, Deanna
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, swung wide, closed steadily, along 2nd
